techmeme.title: FTC source: Microsoft ditching its OpenAI board observer seat is unlikely to resolve the FTC's concerns, as the agency conducts an antitrust review of AI deals (Foo Yun Chee/Reuters)
Microsoft and trade group CISPE agree a deal to settle CISPE's antitrust complaint; CISPE members can run software on Azure at prices equivalent to Microsoft's (Foo Yun Chee/Reuters)
AMD agrees to buy Helsinki-based Silo AI, which offers tailored AI models and platforms to enterprise customers, for $665M in cash; Silo has a 300-person team (Financial Times)
Samsung Galaxy Z Fold6 and Z Flip6 hands-on: much better cameras, expanded Galaxy AI features, 12GB of RAM, and 10% stronger frames, but both cost $100 more (Sam Rutherford/Engadget)
Intuit plans to cut ~10% of its global workforce, or ~1,800 employees, and rehire the same number of staff, primarily in engineering, product, and sales (Brody Ford/Bloomberg)
